characters: YOU HERE I'M GONNA POUND YOUR ASS
NANCY THOMPSON, DONALD THOMPSON, ROLAND KINCAID, JOSEPH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GRAY SURFACE FILLS THE SCREEN.  At first it's hard to  recognize this rough, indistinct surface.  But when a CHI HAND drags a piece of colored chalk ACROSS THE FRAME, we  realize that we're seeing a very close view of a CONCRETE WALKWAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SERIES OF CLOSE SHOTS FOLLOW THE MOVEMENTS of the tiny as it proceeds to lay out an intricate CHALK DRAWING on t walkway. For a while, we are too close to identify the image that being created.  But as THE CAMERA PULLS BACK, we see a  youthful artist's representation of a two story HOUSE. The CAMERA TILTS UP, revealing a LITTLE GIRL in white dre She's holding a handful of colored chalk.  Behind her sit the ELM STREET HOUSE. As the TITLES END, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trees lining this residential street are bare, and th sway in the breeze that's blowing their dead leaves acros the sidewalk. KRISTEN, a beautiful, but pensive-looking blonde teenager walking slowly towards the ominous house.  Although her f shows signs of fear, she is moving with resolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen stops and looks down at the angelic little girl w has been creating the childish drawing of Freddy's house. Kneeling down beside her, Kristen takes a closer look at colorful chalk sketch. It has an almost exaggerated cheerfulness.  And although  awkwardly rendered, it makes the house look new, and the well-tended.  The idyllic sidewalk illustration looks not like its subject, which has peeling paint, boarded-up  windows, and is horribly run-down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you live here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody lives here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Freddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giggles strangely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not home. Just then, the child lifts her hand away from the picture What Kristen sees makes her gasp.  A crudely drawn, but  easily recognizable image of FREDDY KRUEGER is visible be one of the windows. There is a CRACK of LIGHTNING, and drops of rain start to sprinkle down on to the girl and her drawing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen glances up at the sky.  Rain trickles onto her fa Then after a second, she looks back down at the sidewalk. THE LITTLE GIRL IS GONE.  Kristen scans the area, but the child is nowhere to be seen. Rain is splashing down on the chalk illustration. Not onl the image washing away, but as the colors blend together, they form a liquid that looks just like BLOOD. Kristen hears a CREAKING NOISE coming from the direction the house.  She turns and stares at the menacing structur The front door is SLOWLY OPENING.  Somehow Kristen seems  unsurprised by this.  And as though drawn by an  uncontrollable urge, she turns toward the house.  With  thunder and lightning crashing above her, she walks  deliberately toward the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As soon as Kristen enters the house, she hears VOICES beh her.  It's CHILDREN SINGING a strange nursery rhyme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One two, Freddy's coming for you... Kristen spins around and looks back through the open door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: standing out in the yard that was empty a moment before a dozen very young CHILDREN.  Dressed in their Sunday best, they are staring at Kristen as they continue to sing:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three four, better lock the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door SLAMS SHUT with a bang.  Kristen's determi expression dissolves, and she reaches back for the doorkn It turns without resistance and the door opens with ease. Kristen rushes through the doorway, but instead of findin herself outside, she is in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen's eyes widen as she compares her surroundings wit the dusty, decaying room that is visible on the other sid the still-open door.  They are exactly the same. Before she can take another step, the door slams shut aga And this time when she tries to open it, it's locked soli

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm and cool, I'm calm and cool... She moves down the hall, finds an open door, steps throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen walks in, the old floorboards creaking under her  feet.  She looks at the walls.  They are lined with eerie paintings of children playing in graveyards.  Rainwater d down from the ceiling. When FLASHES OF LIGHTNING illuminate the room, Kristen  catches sights of an old and dusty couch in one corner. couch with a distinctive RED AND GREEN STRIPED LINING. Another bolt FLASHES.  Kristen is horrified to see,  silhouetted on one of the walls, the shadow of a hand wit long, knife-like fingers. So frightened that she can barely breathe, Kristen turns the LARGE WINDOW across the room.   ANOTHER FLASH lights up the dark room, and Kristen relaxe It isn't Freddy outside the window.  It's only a tree bra Relieved, Kristen starts over toward the window.  But bef she reaches it, there is a sudden, massive CLAP OF THUNDE and the entire window EXPLODES into the room. A huge gust of WIND roars in through the shattered window and blows Kristen off her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen tumbles down a set of heavy metal chute that has appeared out of nowhere, and lands on the concrete floor very large, dark Boiler Room.  She scrambles to her feet looks around, terrified like a trapped animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under her breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here, he's dead.  He's not here,  he's dead.  He's... Just then, Kristen hears the unmistakable SOUND of Freddy knives scraping against a nearby metal surface. KRISTEN (cont'd) (crying out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!  Kincaide!  Joey!  Help me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid is sitting at his desk, his head drooped down ove open copy of an illustrated sports magazine.  A harmless- looking MONGREL is sleeping at his feet. Suddenly, Kincaid's chair BEGINS TO SHAKE.  He lifts his in surprise just as he suddenly flies from the chair and  sails through the air, straight towards a wall in his roo But instead of piling into the solid surface, Kincaid sai right through it and DISAPPEARS into the void.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid falls into the Boiler Room, crashing through a pi of rusty pipes and boilers.  As soon as he catches his  breath, he looks up and sees Kristen.  He quickly jumps t his feet and starts to yell at his friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awww shit, Kristen, not again.... Kristen motions for Kincaid to LISTEN as the SCREECHING  continues.   Kincaid, unimpressed, shows Kristen that it's merely the  metal arature of a boiler attachment SCRAPING against a  railing. KINCAID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are one spooked chick... Before Kincaid can say another word, Kristen holds up her hand.  FOOTSTEPS are echoing out of the shadows behind th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh... They both spin around just as a FIGURE lurches toward the Kincaid gasps, and Kristen screams.  But a moment later t each let out big sighs.  It's JOEY.  Kincaid covers his f with cool nonchalance. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, thank God!!  I thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought what?  Of dragging us in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, cut it out.  You're puttin' a dent  in my beauty sleep. They both glare at Kristen.  They're pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a halting voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Freddy... He's here.  I heard him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chill out, Kristen...Freddy's dead,  buried, and consecrated.  We won,  remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back... to get us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now way, Kincaid's right, Fred Krueger is  history, c'mere... He leads her around the Boiler Room.  He makes her touch  pipes, and then positions her in front of the large furna JOEY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look... The pipes are cold, the boiler is  cold... see for yourself. He swings open the iron door on the furnace.  Kristen mov close to look in the black void.  There isn't even the gl of an ember inside.  She turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... ALL AT ONCE, a howling BEAST leaps out of the furnace.  I Kincaid's dog.  Kristen has managed to pull it into her d with its master. The terrified animal clamps its jaws around Kristen's arm and knocks the screaming girl down to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey wakes up with a start, and tries to re-orient himsel His sudden movements cause his waterbed to slosh back and forth like crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid jerks his head up off his desk, and glances aroun his room with an expression of relief.  Then he hears a  WHIMPERING sound and looks down. His dog is staring up at him with uncomprehending eyes.   There is BLOOD around the animal's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen throws her covers off and jumps up out of bed.  S breathing hard and her arm is BLEEDING.  Grabbing a T-shi off a chair, Kristen wraps it around the wound. She sits back down on her bed. She looks really scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning sun is rising behind the broad-limbed trees t shade a collection of unassuming homes.  It's a peaceful  neighborhood.  Just the kind that Freddy used to like. A girl pulls up in front of one house.  She's driving a V Rabbit Convertible. It's Kristen.  She wears a long sleeve shirt, but a bulge reveals where her arm is bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen quickly walks to the side door of a modest house. After ringing the bell, she glances out at the sidewalk. Kristen turns back, a STERN-LOOKING MAN is standing in th open doorway.  Although probably not much over forty, DEN JOHNSON'S face shows a lot of wear; too much scotch, too work.  He's dressed for work and is preparing to leave, b his hangover is self-evident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, Mr. Johnson? Johnson ignores her. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's nice. Johnson turns away.  His daughter ALICE shows up at the d slinking warily by her father.  In a definite contrast to Kristen's easy beauty, Alice is not especially well put  together.  And yet there's something about this shy-looki girl that suggests that she might be incredibly attractiv she had any confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (low)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Kristen...Rick'll be out any second. Kristen looks in the doorway at Johnson who is holding a  tomato-juice and spices hangover delight.  Kristen makes face.  Alice turns as Johnson looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You going out dressed like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhh, I'll just wait outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's okay.  Maybe you can help her. Johnson pours a shot of Vodka into his morning concoction SLAMS the door shut, leaving the two girls alone on the f porch.  Kristen is about to console Alice when they HEAR RUSTLING sound above them.  RICK, Alice's brother, is  shimmying out of an upper floor window. He reaches for a nearby tree, and with surprising grace h maneuvers to the ground and lands smiling in front of the girls.  He gives Kristen a quick kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something wrong with the stairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avoid-all-contact-day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When dad's popping aspiring like popcorn,  it's avoid-all-contact-day. Johnson suddenly reopens the door and reaches for the mor newspaper.  He stares at the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting for a limo? Rick grabs his father's face and gives him a big, noisy k on the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mock Ricky Ricardo)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honey.  I'm off to the club! The girls chuckle as Johnson becomes embarrassed and SLAM the door on the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Springwood High doesn't look particularly inviting, but h many high schools do?  STUDENTS are arriving on foot, on  bikes, and in a variety of motor vehicles. Kristen, Rick and Alice pull up in Kristen's VW Rabbit  Convertible and park.  They step onto the sidewalk and cr along beside the STUDENT PARKING LOT.  They stop beside a ATTRACTIVE GIRL who is leaning against a car, listening t the blasting radio inside. The girl, DEBBIE STEVENS, is one well put together item. tough but smart girl from the wrong side of the tracks,  trying to compensate for her roots with defensive spunk,  sexy, and she knows it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, anybody have trig this semester? Alice, Rick and Kristen shake their heads 'no'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a conflict.  Homework or Dynasty.   Dynasty won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sad story.  Those soaps'll kill ya. Alice's attention drifts to a tough PICK-UP that is pulli up not far from them.  A handsome, dark-haired TEENAGER, climbs out of the car. Debbie eyes him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (appreciative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's Dan Jordan.  Mmmmm, we're talkin'  major league fox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin DAYDREAM. JUMP CUT to Dan standing directly in front of Alice.  She in a more confident, seductive pose.  She looks him up an down and flashes a Lauren Bacall smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmmm, you know, you are one major  league fox. She puts a hand on Dan's waist.  He grows nervous and  awkward, as if he's the shy one now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stammers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T-T-Thanks Alice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth to Alice... Alice snaps out of it.  Dan is suddenly back where he was walking away with a group of his friends. RICK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You spacing again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hush-hush)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I think I see salvation... A battered and sputtering VESPA SCOOTER is zipping toward them through the parking lot.  The BLACK GIRL riding the  scooter looks a bit nerdy, with thick glasses and short h but makes up for it with a hip sense of style.  Her scoot has been souped up with a few home-made gadgets and  attachments. As soon as SHEILA KOPECKY reaches them, she hops off her  bike, and unstraps the pile of books and papers from the  back.  Tons of SMOKE pour out the back of it. DEBBIE (cont'd) (bats smoke away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you ride that health hazard?   It's no wonder you have asthma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asthma is an inherited condition.  If you  read a book now and then, you might know  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of books, isn't trig your  favorite? Sheila stares at Debbie a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dynasty again, huh?  Girl, get a VCR. Sheila pulls out her asthma inhaler and sticks it in her  mouth.  She takes a few puffs.  A cocky, obnoxious BLACK walks by and comments to Sheila.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo, baby, you're sucking on the wrong  nozzle. Sheila is embarrassed and falls short of managing a retor Debbie steps in between Sheila and the jock and does it f her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, needledick.  I bet you're the only  male in this school suffering from penis  envy. The jock stares in confusion, not quite understanding the insult.  Our group cracks up and pats Debbie on the shoul as the jock walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, I owe you one. Debbie suddenly stops laughing and lets out a disgusted G A huge ROACH is crawling around her books.  She shakes th book until the bug falls off, then grinds it under her fo a little too enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Supergirl, I think it's dead. The group gets their stuff together and heads for class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STUDENTS are moving through the hallway that cuts through center of Springwood High. Kristen is standing against one wall, spinning the dial o her locker.  Rick can be seen a dozen lockers down from h Kristen gets the locker open, grabs a couple of her books then slams it shut.  But as the locker door swings away, SUDDENLY REVEALS the faces of Kincaid and Joey just inche from Kristen.  They startle the hell out of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi...guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys?!?  Hi guys?!?!  That's all you  got to say after last night? Kristen studies her two angry friends for a moment, then  speaks up in a firm voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, he's coming back! He tries to move around, but bumps his head on something

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo open this sucker up!! He pounds on the metal above. It moves just enough to rev a thin crack of blue light.  He continues to mutter to  himself in confusion. He pounds a few more times, starting to panic, when the m above his head finally pops open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid sticks his head out of the trunk of a wrecked car looks around.  He's in an ominous auto graveyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ain't my dreamland.  KRISTEN.  IF

dialogues.speaker: YOU HERE I'M GONNA POUND YOUR ASS
dialogues.text: Kincaid looks around.  No one's to be seen. KINCAID (cont'd) (calling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen!!  Hey, Kristen!! (beat, then sheepishly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen? He collects himself and puts on a badass walking gait.  W he hears a low GROWLING, Kincaid looks down.  A few feet from him is his dog.  It has an odd expression on its fac KINCAID (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason? (relaxes, becomes sympathetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen little sister, we know you got  this talent for bringing folks into your  dreams, but we don't need it anymore.   Time to live like regular people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let it rest. 'Sides, who knows, you might  stir him back up if you keep going in.   Kincaid and I'll help, we're still a  team, and we ALL have better things to  dream about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that right, signed and sealed. Kristen wants to believe, but she can't, because:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what about this? Kristen pulls up her sleeve, and reveals the blood-staine bandage on her forearm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That don't mean dick.  My dog's like me.   Drag him into a crazy dream and he gets  wild. The guys see Rick approaching. KINCAID (cont'd) (jokingly, trying to change the  subject)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here comes your boyfriend.  Can't he give  you a good night's sleep? Rick arrives in time to hear Kincaid's comment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't kiss and tell.  How 'bout you  guys? Kincaide starts to mount a comeback, but Joey pulls him a Kristen watches them disappear into the crowd. RICK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those guys are kind of spooky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you must think I'm a total freak. Rick ponders this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I go back and forth. Kristen is not amused. RICK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lighten up.  No one died. Rick strokes her cheek.  Kristen forces a weak smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid is getting into bed.  His night time attire consi of a T-shirt and a pair of sweat pants. As the sleepy young man settles between the sheets, a FOR begins to slowly open the door behind him.  It SQUEAKS as inches open.  Kincaid is on alert.  After a few moments o suspense, Kincaid's mangy dog shoves the door the rest of way open, and trots into the room. The mutt hops up onto the bed and circles a couple of tim When it finally lies down, Kincaid shoves it over a bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Jason, move over. The dog and his master adjust their positions, then Kinca reaches over and turns off the light.

dialogues.speaker: KINCAID
dialogues.text: His eyes slowly shut.  The room is still.  But suddenly a SCREECHING SOUND wakes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid opens his eyes.  It's too dark for him to see muc so he reaches for the light on his bedstand.  But instead finding a lamp, his hand slams against a metal surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog is furiously digging below the back of an imposin looking OLD CADILLAC.  Some strange instinct seems to hav overpowered the animal.  The boy rushes forward and tries to stop his dog.  But it no longer acting like a friendly pet, and it turns and sn at him viciously. Kincaid stops and stares in disbelief as the dog lifts it leg and PISSES FIRE onto the spot where it's been digging A FLAMING STREAM runs along the ground, and a moment late the earth RUMBLES and starts to CRACK OPEN along this lin fire.  Shafts of light erupt out of the crack. Its job complete, the dog howls and runs off into the nig Kincaid watches it disappear between the stacks of cars, steps forward and looks down into the SMOLDERING PIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down at the bottom of this freshly formed crevice, a pile BONES is forming itself into a HUMAN SKELETON.  They clic together like a machine gun put together by an experience soldier.   And as if that isn't creepy enough, a body is quickly  REGENERATING. FLESH appears on the bones.  Cartilage knits the joints, muscle swells within the OOZING TISSUE that is forming al over the body.  It's the antithesis of decomposition. When BURNED SKIN forms over the flesh, and clothes revers their rot and cover the skin, there is no longer any doub who's rebirth we are witnessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid watches in horror as the sinister figure rises fr the grave.  FREDDY'S BACK. Freddy raises his right hand, and with a flick of his wri extends the long shiny BLADES at the ends of the fingers  (like switch blades.).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't've buried me...I'm not  dead. Kincaid doesn't hesitate for another second.  Before Fred even starts to move toward him, the terrified dreamer tur and runs.  He finds the opening where he entered, and mad squeezes himself back through it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid starts to weave his way through the maze of piled cars. He turns a corner and pauses to catch his breath.  He loo around.  There's no sign of Freddy.  Breathing hard, he t around at the piles of cars around him.  The expression o his face tells us he's got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: ON FREDDY
dialogues.text: He round the corner and stops, there's no Kincaid.  He lo around, confused.  He HEARS the SQUEAK of metal.

dialogues.speaker: ON KINCAID
dialogues.text: Who's on top of a pile of cars.  He's straining with his  super dream-strength to push the top car off the pile.  H succeeds. The car topples down onto Freddy, squashing him flat.  A  victorious Kincaid jumps down onto the roof, then hood of car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take that, mutha-fucker! Kincaide jumps to the ground.  As soon as he lands, the c around him go wild.  HORNS HONK, lights flash, windshield wipers wipe. Suddenly before Kincaid can react, cars start to pile in  around him.  He spins around to watch as he is quickly bo in by piles of cars which come crashing in. Kincaid is boxed in like a trapped mouse.  The HORNS on t cars around him HONK and headlights flash at him.  There is no way out.  He's completely trapped in a space much larger than a single car. Suddenly, Kincaid hears a SCRAPING NOISE right behind him Freddy's claws are SCRAPING a windshield. He spins around, and finds FREDDY standing just inches aw with his knives raised. Freddy brings his blades down and jams them into Kincaid' chest. KINCAID (cont'd) (gurgling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiss my ass, I'll see you in hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them Freddy sent ya!! HAHAHAHA! Freddy pushes the knives farther and farther into Kincaid The tips of the sharp blades POP out of the center of  Kincaid's back.  ONE AT A TIME, ACCENTED BY CRUEL SOUND F FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One down...two to go...hahahah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid's eyes shoot open and he clutches his chest in ag His dog wakes and nuzzles up to his dying master, but the is oblivious to the dog's tender attention. With his final breath, Kincaid tries unsuccessfully to ca out Kristen's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen is sitting in bed with her knees drawn to her che Holding her breath, she's listening.  The room is silent. must have been the wind tickling the chimes outside her  window that drew her attention. She sighs, and reaches for the can of hi-caf Cola that's  sitting beside her.   She takes a final swig, then tosses the can in the waste  basket, where it joins a number of other empties. Kristen rummages through the drawer in her nightstand, an grabs some cigarettes and matches.  She gets out of bed,  crosses to the window, and slides it open. She slumps into the chair beside the window, and lights a match by striking it against her thumbnail.  Very cool. lights the cigarette and takes a deep drag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice can be seen by the kitchen window.  A sliver of lig creeps out of the garage, along with a THUMPING NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is involved in a series of interesting exercises.  H kicking and sparring with a suspended bodybag, doing mart arts spins between returns.  He wears an oriental bandana around his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is standing at the sink in front of the kitchen win finishing up a stack of dishes.  She looks up when headli sweep across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car is swerving into the driveway. It makes an awkward  approach, and knocks over a garbage can that's positioned well off to one side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stops his exercises and steps away from the opening  electric door.  The car jerks into the garage, and Johnso climbs out.  As he walks uneasily to the house, he takes quick nip from the bottle he's brought home.  Johnson bec self conscious when he sees his sone watching him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First one of the day, scout's honor. He shuffles by Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnson comes in and crosses to Alice.  Rick follows as f as the doorway but holds his position there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late, I know, damn contracts...Let's  eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We waited a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we gave up.  As usual. Alice takes a salad bowl out of the fridge and places it front of her father as he sits down at the table.  Johnso stares at the salad in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You call this vegetation a meal after a  ten hour work day?  What the hell am I?   A rabbit?  Christ, Alice, can't you try  to think a little more?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Begin daydream.  Alice suddenly SMASHES the salad off the table.  She turns angrily on her father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I can think!  I can think of how  sick I am watching you drink your life  away and taking it out on me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: End daydream.  Alice's father is staring at her.  The sal is back on the table.  All is as it was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I speak in foreign tongues?  Alice,  I'm talking to you.  Are you awake or  what? Alice doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, don't start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start what?  Telling the little  daydreamer to wake up?  It's long  overdue. Johnson gets up and heads out. JOHNSON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell with this.   JOHNSON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aggravation  I don't need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice stands before a mirror that is virtually covered wi photos.  She seems lost in though and doesn't see Rick st into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think it kind of defeats the  purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mirror.  You can't see yourself in  it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to. Alice takes a picture from the mirror, an old black and w of two little children, herself and Rick much younger wit woman.  A picture of happier times.  Crossing to sit on h bed... ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever wonder how things would be if  Mom were alive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  She'd be half as strict as you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she wouldn't let Dad treat me like  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you gotta stand up for yourself.   Learn to fight back. Rick does a spin and karate kicks high into the air. RICK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all in here. (tapping his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See yourself fighting.  And your body  obeys. Kicking high again. RICK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. He pulls her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick...I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never say can't.  Just do what I do. He spins, stops.  She spins - sort of.  He kicks.  She ki Suddenly her shoe flies off, she hits the floor as her sh lands in the fish tank.  They both die laughing. RICK (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice-son, you must have balance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posters of rock groups and girls line the walls.  The cam pans them slowly, tilting down past a particularly  provocative poster of a sexy bikinied babe.  CAMERA reach the LED display of a stereo's VU meter, which is hitting the red peaks.  But we can barely hear any music. The CAMERA FOLLOWS a headphone cord away from the stereo, passes some gorgeous pin-up POSTERS on the wall, and then finally reveals Joey stretched out on his waterbed.  He h his TV hooked up to his stereo and is watching MTV, which HEARS through the headphones. They're rocking out to a tune that spills out of his  headphones.  He's also flipping through the latest issue Rolling Stone.  His eyes slowly shut. The magazine drops to his chest. ALL AT ONCE, a rocking motion starts to make Joey rock ba and forth.  Something is causing waves within the waterbe Joey snaps to.  He notices that the girl in the slutty po has vanished, leaving only her photographed background. has no time to be puzzled, however as he rolls over and p back the sheets on the bed... To Joey's surprise and delight, a beautiful NAKED GIRL is staring up at him from INSIDE HIS WATERBED. Not just any girl, but the GIRL FROM THE POSTER.  Her hai floating around her face, and she's pressing her body up  against the inside of the clear plastic.  Her voice can't heard, but it looks like she's mouthing Joey's name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a great bed!! Entranced, Joey spreads his arms out over the girl and ti to hug her.  He's in heaven.  She starts to slowly drift from him, DROPPING DOWN into the water until her features no longer clear. SUDDENLY, the swimming figure bobs back up to the surface the bed.  But it's no longer a beautiful girl.  IT'S FRED Our old pal smiles up at Joey and the blades of his knive push against the surface of the vinyl mattress. Joey cries out, but before he has time to react, Freddy's arms rip up through the plastic and grab a hold of the bo As water gushes all over, Freddy's demonic face pops up  behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this for a wet dream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooo!!!!  Kristen!  Help! Freddy pulls Joey back down beneath the surface of the be and holds him under.  Joey thrashes, but its hopeless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two down.  One to go.  Hahahaha! CAMERA moves back around the room to the LED meter, watch as it dies down to nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen is sitting on her window seat, finishing off anot cigarette.  She blows smoke out the window, then uses the butt to light a fresh cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey's MOTHER comes in to say goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey, are you asleep already?  Joey? She gets to the bed.  MOM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, give your mother a kiss. She pulls down the covers to reveal Joey in the bed.  She screams. Joey is floating motionless INSIDE THE WATERBED.  His fac pressed up against the unbroken vinyl surface, his hair i billowing back in the still-swirling current, and his eye are open in an eerie death stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gentle breeze is blowing in the window and Kristen clos her eyes for a few seconds as she lets the fresh air wash across her tired face. Suddenly the wind dies away and the soft sound of the  tinkling chime ABRUPTLY STOPS.  Kristen opens her eyes an stares out the window.  The night air is absolutely still The leaves have stopped fluttering and the wind chime han motionless in the tree. She hears someone calling her, so she gets up and goes ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen comes out and starts to walk slowly away from the door.  She is listening to the FAINT SOUND that is waftin through the air, but she isn't really sure just what it i As Kristen steps away from the house, the CAMERA MOVES wi her in a CONTINUOUS SHOT. So when she turns and heads bac the CAMERA is still following her.  And what Kristen sees makes her scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her home is now gone.  Standing in its place is the decay ELM STREET HOUSE. Kristen spins around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's in a long, weird, thin space between the walls.  Sh passes through a chain curtain and moves further in, the  corridor is filled with WAILING and STRANGE SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen tries to navigate through the thin space.  She  SCREAMS and starts running as arms begin bursting out of sides of the corridor.  She ducks as they grab for her.   They're Freddy-arms, each one weilding his deadly claw. The arms force her down the next segment of the corridor. she looks ahead she sees she's been led straight to Fredd He LAUGHS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you'd be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then there were none... Freddy charges towards her. She turns and runs, but sudde Freddy is right in front of her.  She stops cold and  concentrates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid!  Joey! There's no answer.  No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elm Street's last brat. Freddy steps forward and raises his blades.  He's about t strike.  Trapped, Kristen raises her hands in a final fut attempt at self-defense. But before Freddy can swing his deadly blades down at her Kristen's outstretched arm suddenly BURSTS INTO FLAME.  S screams and then we CUT TO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy's "last brat" line ECHOES a few times before FADIN out as Kristen comes awake. Kristen jumps out of the chair as FLAMES shoot out of her wastebasket.  Her cigarette has started a small fire.  Sh grabs her can of soda and pours the rest out onto the fir putting it out.  She nurtures a small burn on her hand. She turns to the window and cries out under her breath:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joey!  Kincaid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's right before school starts, the grounds are deserted save for Kristen.  She sits alone on the steps, rocking  herself slightly.  She's looked better.  She's nervous an agitated. She reaches into her pocket and withdraws a cigarette.  S takes out a match, ignites it by striking it against her  thumbnail, and lights the cig.  After a deep inhale she b smoke into the morning air. Alice appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you are.  Where were you this  morning?  Rick's looking all over for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very anxious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you seen Joey and Kincaid!  God, I  can't find them.  I can't find them  anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure they're around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (afraid)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm not so sure. Alice sits beside Kristen.  Kristen looks at her.  Each g has bags under their eyes. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have matching luggage again. Alice looks at Kristen, puzzled.  She doesn't get it.   Kristen smiles and puts her finger on the bags under one Alice's eyes. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bags under your eyes.  Nightmares? Alice nods "yes". KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God I hate dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love to dream, I just hate ones about  my dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could do worse. Kristen stamps out her cigarette. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you deal with your nightmares?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom taught me when I was little.  Did  you ever hear of the dream master?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a game show host to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No really, it's a fable.  The 'guardian  of good' dreams.  It was like my teddy  bear when I was growing up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, you wouldn't happen to know his  phone number? Alice laughs. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I daydream.  you have to dream about some  place fun.  Remember you're in control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you learn so much about dreams?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they're all you have, you kinda  become an expert. Kristen gives Alice a sympathetic look.  The two girls si silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to bring people into my dreams. Alice doesn't know what to make of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I used to have nightmares.  I  brought my friends in to help me.  Until  they all started dying. Kristen notices that Alice isn't getting what she's talki about. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never mind.  It's too complicated.  Let's  get in before your brother starts a  search party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A teacher, a young hip man named BRYSON writes on the boa as the final stragglers come in.  Kristen and Alice enter meeting Rick who's there already. Kristen takes on look at the roomful of STUDENTS and all blood drains from her face.  She isn't looking at the  students who are there.  She is staring at TWO EMPTY SEAT Kristen starts to tremble a MURMURING begins deep inside and builds to a tortured CRY as she shakes her head "no". Kristen starts to back away.  Her knees are getting weak. The other students are mesmerized by the outburst.  Some them are glancing over at the empty seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God!  He killed them! Rick takes hold of her arm, but she's really losing it no and she pulls herself away from him with all her strength The momentum of this violent move throws her off balance she falls back, slamming against the door.  She strikes h head, slumps to the floor, knocked out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCHOOL NURSE is passing an ampule of smelling salts und Kristen's nose.  She shakes her head, then opens her eyes The Nurse leans down over her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (groggy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I guess so... What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had a nasty bump. As Kristen's sense of focus returns, she looks up at the  Nurse with an expression of extreme urgency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just stay put.  You need rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't get it, he's after me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, honey The woman turns and sets down the smelling salts.  Her ba begins to bleed, blood soaks through her white uniform,  saturating the fabric, Kristen's eyes widen in horror.  W she turns back an instant later, she's no longer the Nurs Now standing above Kristen is FREDDY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to draw some blood... Kristen lets out a scream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen's eyes suddenly SNAP OPEN.  The Nurse is passing ampule of smelling salts under the girl's nose.  The woma leans down over her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feeling better now? Kristen doesn't say a word. ROCK AND ROLL MUSIC builds on the soundtrack as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC is blasting as CARS pull up and KIDS make their way into the CRAVE INN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU of jukebox.  PULL BACK as Dan and his buddy walk fro t jukebox to their table.  Dan passes by the counter and  glances at Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, you seen Rick around? Alice is surprised and almost drops an order.  She shakes head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're his sister, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stayed later after school with  Kristen.  She wasn't feeling very well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I was looking for him, okay? (his eyes smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Dan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  Uh...Alice. Dan is already walking away toward his table.  Alice pick an order and watches Dan walk away.  Debbie, who is also waitress, steps in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Alice.  You're shift's over.  My  table now. Debbie walks to Dan's table.  Sheila catches Alice off-gu (They both watch Debbie talking to Dan.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mimicking Debbie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, handsome.  Care for some buns? Alice turns to see Sheila in front of her with a check. both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You in a hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get to the library before it  closes.  Killer physics test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  I hardly have any time to study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you shouldn't be working here so  much.  You don't want to get stuck  waiting tables for the rest of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. Debbie returns from Dan's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's so cute.  I wonder where he works  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please save us, Deb.  There IS life after  exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of these days I'll fix you up with a  real guy.  Teach you to get your  priorities straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Sheila's more interested in  dissecting bodies than just admiring  them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give her time.  Beauty is skin deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb, you're hopeless.  Later in life  you'll appreciate my motto: mind over  matter. Sheila gathers her books.  Alice starts cleaning the tabl nearby as Rick and Kristen walk in.  They startle Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (urgently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice, you think you can leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kincaid and Joey died last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Over at the next table, Dan sees Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yells)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, ladies.  I'll just be a  moment. Rick takes off for the table.  Alice and Kristen huddle  closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen, what happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll hear all kinds of stories.   They'll tell you it was murder, but it  wasn't. Alice tries to comfort Kristen who is now crying. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could I let him get them?  Kincaid,  the badass motherfucker with the heart of  gold.  And Joey, shy, sweet Joey.  So shy  and so oversexed. Kristen smiles through her tears.  Good memories. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were a team. Alice is speechless.  Suddenly Kristen turns hard. KRISTEN (cont'd) (steely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get that sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Kristen doesn't seem to hear her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick!  C'mon!  We gotta go now! Rick comes over with Dan who looks concerned. KRISTEN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan's seated in the backseat.  He looks slightly silly  sitting next to the shy Alice, who's desperately trying n to make eye contact with him.  She sneaks little peeks. Debbie is seated in back on the other side of Dan.  She's trying very hard to make eye contact with Dan.  Rick's in front with Kristen. A conversation is in progress.  Kristen is finishing up a story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you know who and what Freddy really  is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I though Freddy was just an old town  story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no story.  It happened.  Freddy's  real and he's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mon!  Everybody has nightmares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know what nightmares are.  You  play by Freddy's rules.  Wake up or die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice neighborhood. Everyone in the car has been leaning in towards Kristen,  engrossed in her story.  Rick grows uncomfortable with th crowding, as if he had a strong aversion to tight spaces  which we would like to telegraph for later exploitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mon!  Give me some room!  I hate  tight spaces. Those in the back seat back off.  Kristen speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's car and Dan's truck pull up in front of the boarde up, run down house.  They get out of their respective car and meet on the front of the walkway, surrounded by a wee infested front lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why the haunted house?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids died there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Dan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no just a house. It's his home.   He's waiting there for me...to dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, babe.  We're with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you you can't help.  This isn't a  normal nightmare. I'm doomed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers pulling him aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me talk to you. Alice takes Kristen aside.  Continue scene with Dan and R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's up?  What'd I miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told us the story of Freddy.  It's a  town legend.  He was a child killer who  was freed on a technicality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It pissed off a lot of parents.   According to Kristen, they hunted him  down; roasted him alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice neighborhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it gets weird.  She says he comes  back in dreams.  If he kills you there,  you're dead for real. On Kristen and Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm beginning to feel like an endangered  species. Alice is staring at the house.  She suddenly speaks, almo to herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now I lay me down to sleep..." Kristen glances over at Alice who notices Kristen's  attention. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dream master.  I think I remember the  rhyme.  "The master of dreams, my soul  I'll keep..." She falters, stops. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I forgot the rest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  It's only a prayer, no good  to Freddy's realm. A car's HONKING commands the kids' attention.  ELAINE,  Kristen's mom, pulls up.  She shouts at Kristen from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen!  Get the hell away form that  house and get in this car.  Andele! Rick, Debbie and Dan walk over to Kristen and Alice.  Kri starts to head for the car.  Rick puts a hand on her  shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go if you don't want to.  I can  take care of you. Elaine impatiently HONKS the HORN again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better go. Rick leans in and gently kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you tonight.  We'll get through  this. They are near the curb, Alice stops as something on the  walkway catches her attention.  There are traces of a cha drawing on the concrete.  Alice bends down and runs a fin across its surface. RICK (O.S. cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice? She looks up to Dan and Rick.  She starts to join them.   Before she goes, she turns and looks back down.  The draw is gone.  She stares at the walkway a beat before joining Dan, Rick and Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elaine is silently watching her daughter eat.  You could the tension with a knife.  Finally, Elaine speaks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something the matter with the cuisine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Mom, I'll tell ya, when two of your  friends die the same day, you let me know  what it does to your appetite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just tired.  Don't think I haven't  noticed your not sleeping.  That has to  stop, honey. Kristen quickly stands, but she's dizzy.  She grabs a hol the table to steady herself, then sits back down again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your distraught.  It'll help... There's a straightened tone in her mother's voice that is making Kristen's eyes open wide.  She's starting to  understand what's happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God...No...What'd you do? Kristen grabs her glass, and pours the last of her milk o onto the table.  There's a grainy sediment remaining in t bottom of the glass. When Kristen stands again, she's unsteady on her feet. Sh tries to brace herself on the back of her chair with one  hand, and when she does this, she loses her grip on the e milk glass and it falls and shatters on the floor. With a wobbling gait, Kristen lurches away from the table Kristen stumbles around, grabs her mother's purse and dum its contents on the counter.  Fumbling around, she finds half-full container of prescription capsules.  She turns throws it at Elaine.  Pills fly everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry honey, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry!! Sorry that you and your tennis  pals torched this guy who's now after me.   In case you haven't been keeping score,  it's his fucking banquet, and I'm the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, we went over this in therapy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother, you've just murdered me.  Take  that to your goddamn therapy...

dialogues.speaker: ON DESERTED BEACH
dialogues.text: Wearing club med beach wear, Kristen is lying on a towel beach that runs along the edge of a broad lake.  The sun high and the sky is blue. KRISTEN (cont'd) (softly to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Alice. She slowly glances around the beach.  Down near the water LITTLE GIRL is building a SAND CASTLE. When the child turns and looks at her, Kirsten sees that the same little girl that she saw drawing a picture on th sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: JUST OFF THE SHORE
dialogues.text: The glassy surface of the water is unexpectedly broken by LIKE OBJECTS that rise up and slice through the surf.  At first it looks like a shark, but as it gets closer, we ca clearly see that it is FOUR BLADES in ascending height.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: Kristen looks back at the Sand Castle, but the little gir gone.  She does not notice the fins.

dialogues.speaker: THE FINS
dialogues.text: They turn and head straight for shore, directly in line w the Sand Castle and Kristen beyond it.  When they reach t shore, they continue straight on, cutting THROUGH THE SAN now instead of the water.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: The knife-like fins move through the sand and enter the f of the Elm Street Sand Castle.  At this point, the sand  castle CHANGES INTO A SAND CASTLE OF THE ELM STREET HOUSE then EXPLODES, revealing: Freddy, squinting against the harsh sunlight.  Freddy pop a pair of Ray-Bans.  He smiles as he steps forward and st over Kristen, his backlit form is towering above her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time to turn, or else you'll burn! Kristen is sunken halfway into the sand, preventing escap Freddy raises his claw as if to attack Kristen and the sh of the claw BURNS BLISTERS onto her otherwise pale skin. Freddy saunters over, unaffected by the quicksand.  He  watches the girl struggle and laughs when her screaming m fills with sand as she SINKS BELOW THE SURFACE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen appears, hanging upside down on all fours on the  ceiling of the room. She's disoriented.  She starts to ge some kind of bearing and starts crawling towards a wall. She makes it and struggles to reach a door.  She crawls d the wall and manages to open the door.  She flings hersel through it. Kristen is horrified to discover that she is back in the  boiler room.  The place is really strange now. There's a and steam all around She realizes she's standing on a catwalk high above the r She looks around and sees that Freddy is standing in fron a furnace, watching her with a grin on his face. With a defiant cry, Kristen runs at Freddy.  She does a  series of cartwheels and throws herself at her tormentor, crashing into him. Caught off guard, Freddy stumbles backwards and falls ont the grating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it til ya dizzy...hahahahaha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We beat you before!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're all alone! Freddy advances on the terrified girl. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Kristen!  Why don't you call in some  help? Freddy closes in.  Kristen struggles not to drag anyone i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never...I'm the last. Freddy's almost on top of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reach out and touch someone. Freddy raises his claw to slash Kristen.  She panics and reflex, calls for:

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Alice comes crashing down ON TOP of them.  Kris is enraged. But Freddy is happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How sweet!  Fresh meat! Kristen suddenly SLAPS Alice HARD across the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!!  Wake up and get OUT!!  It was  a mistake, oh God I'm sorry. Nothing happens, Kristen starts to back up, taking Alice her.  Freddy pulls open his shirt and reveals the TORTURE FACES of the souls of his previous victims. KRISTEN (cont'd) (stepping forward)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave her alone!!! Freddy grabs Kristen, and as Alice reacts in utter horror throws her into a nearby wall in which appears a burning of flames. Kristen writhes as she burns. As the flames finish off the doomed girl, a BLAST OF ENER shoots out of the steaming furnace and slams into Freddy. His body crackles, he arches his back and seems to grow a CONTORTS and PULSATES.

dialogues.speaker: NOW, NO ONE SLEEPS
dialogues.text: He starts to advance on the terrified Alice.  As Kristen  roasts to a fiery death, she calls out to Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pained)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll need my power... A second bolt of energy flies from Kristen's body inside furnace and SLAMS into Alice, causing her to glow and sha Freddy closes in for the kill and is about to slice into  Alice. KRISTEN'S SMOLDERING FACE pushes out and emerges onto  Freddy's chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice sits bolt upright in bed, screaming.  She takes a f breathes, gets her bearings then walks towards her vanity She stares at the mirror. One of the pictures on it is new.  It's a snapshot of a  beaming Freddy and a terrified Kristen down in the boiler room.  Freddy smiles for the camera.  Alice stares at it. She turns it over. There's an inscription on the back.  It reads FREDDY AND  KRISTEN, HELL, 1988.  The picture suddenly BURSTS into fl and disintegrates, startling Alice.  She looks back at th mirror.  The hole the picture has left on the reflective  surface allows Alice to see a portion of her face. Her  reflection is subtly altered, more enhanced. Rick bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen... She grabs him and pulls him out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Alice pull up to Kristen's house and get out of  Rick's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dancing orange of flames can be seen in Kristen's  upstairs bedroom window. Rick and Alice charge into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Alice and Elaine enter the room.  The bed is in a b of FLAMES.  The last of Kristen is just a CHARRED ARM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is sitting on a bench wearing dark sunglasses. The  oriental bandana ties tightly around his forehead.  He's mourning.  Seated around him are Alice, who's dressed a b like Kristen, Debbie and Dan.  Silence surrounds them.  E is respectful of Rick's mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man, we're all sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew she was gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean it was like, suicide? Dan cuts in, not letting Debbie finish her sentence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was an accident.  Smoking in  bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was no suicide.  It was not an  accident.  It was Freddy, and he's coming  back for seconds, thirds, and fourths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Freddy's not real.  She couldn't  have been serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, you can't really believe that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was there in the dream.  He took her.   It was awful.  It was awful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "In her dream"? Alice gets up and abruptly walks away from the bench.  Ri takes off his glasses and watches his sister go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's very wrong here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a minute she...well, reminded me of  Kristen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weren't they close? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice stares at her reflection for a few moments. She stu it.  She leans in real close to the mirror's surface. She takes out a cigarette, sticks it in her mouth and lig it by striking a match against her thumbnail, eerily  reminiscent of Kristen. She takes a drag and COUGHS violently.  She quickly stamp out.  She looks into the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't smoke. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen, what did you do to me? Sheila enters the restroom, heads for a faucet next to Al and immediately splashes her face with cold water.  Alice watches her.  She gets a look at Sheila's tired face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhhbaby, I am dead on my feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have matching luggage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Again, reminiscent of Kristen, Alice points to a spot und Sheila's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been up all night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That obvious, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you saw him, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw who? I was up all night cramming for  this physics test, and I was putting this  little baby together.  Look... Sheila reaches into her purse and withdraws a small, neat looking gadget, not unlike a joy buzzer, only this means  business.  She squeezes it and it emits a HIGH-PITCHED WH SHEILA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how Debbie's afraid of bugs?  I  made this for her. Ultra high sound  waves.  Makes 'em run screaming their  antenna off. Sheila collects herself and starts to leave. SHEILA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See ya in class. She exits, leaving Alice alone in the rest room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The STUDENTS are sitting at their desks, waiting for the  dreaded exam.  Sheila starts to wheeze a little, but she  takes a hit off of her aspirator, and that settles her do She looks exhausted. While the TEACHER places test papers face down in front o each of the students, Sheila checks out her CLASSMATES.   Alice and Rick are there, and so is Dan. When the teacher finally gets to Sheila, he drops the tes front of her, giving her a little slap on the back. The teacher glances up at the clock above the blackboard, then turns to the students.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright...you have forty minutes.  Good  luck and go to it. Test papers are turned over.  The examination has begun. Concentration, scribbling, thinking, cheating, satisfacti and despair.  It's all there. Sheila is staring at her paper.  She holds her eyes open  wide.  They slowly shut, for a second.  She recovers and  opens her eyes wide again.  She stares back at the paper.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE TEST
dialogues.text: The equations dance about on the page like acrobats.  She blinks in confusion, yet they still move.  She takes a lo around.  All the other students are working, including Al Sheila's pen is poised over her paper, her eyes get heavy her head droops forward, but she again snaps to with a st She shakes her head and looks down at her test.  Sheila p her pencil to paper and tries to fill in an answer, but n writing appears on the paper. Blinking again, the equations on the page start to dance. Slowly the letters start to form words again.  They spell LEARNING IS FUN WITH FREDDY. Sheila shakes her head and looks around.  Then she looks at her page where a drop of blood splatters.  Her pen is  leaking blood. Alice, awake, turns and notices Sheila's troubles.  No on else in the classroom reacts. Sheila tries to clean the blood with her hand, making an bigger mess.  Then HER HAND PUSHES RIGHT INTO THE DESK. struggles to free it, but she's pulled even further.   Suddenly she pulls it free, looks around, relieved.  The  tension mounts, then suddenly a mechanical beastie type c thing jumps out of the desk and grabs hold of Sheila's ar She yells. Alice turns and sees Sheila struggling.  Alice starts to when a bar shoots out across her lap and straps her in. S struggles to help Sheila.  But all the other students are calmly involved in the test. Sheila looks forward at the teacher's desk.  Freddy sits the table, peeling an apple with a claw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School's out. Finally Sheila pulls her arm free, but the bar slips arou her waist, entrapping her. Freddy heads down the aisle. Sheila's breathing all but stops.  She tries to scream, b can only choke and wheeze. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck me sideways...Save your breath. Freddy yanks Sheila to him and kisses her hard on the mou and begins to suck, literally drawing the air from her lu The Freddy-created-vacuum is intense.  Sheila's ribs are  drawn into themselves and CRACK IN HALF.  Her body is  imploding as her insides, life essence, is sucked complet dry. Young skin now cracked and peeling brown.  The rind you t away.  Freddy lets go of Sheila's shell and it drops to t desk with a dusty THUD. FREDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, you fail. Freddy turns to the terrified Alice. He walks over,  screeching his talons on the blackboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Freddy is gone and Sheila is lying across her d choking for air, while the teacher and students gather  around.  Alice fumbles with Sheila's inhalator, forcing i into her mouth, but Sheila's head just droops to one side.  Dead. Alice is suddenly hit by a JOLT.  She recovers after a sh moment. Sheila's home-made zapper falls out of one pocket and fal on the floor.  Alice quickly scoops it up. Rick, Dan and Debbie surround her.  Alice starts to freak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you see it?  He was here. They all stare at her strangely.  Rick leads her carefull from the classroom, supporting her exhausted body.  The o students file out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The test wasn't that bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: School's been let out for the day and dozens of STUDENTS standing around the parking lot, watching the paramedics a nylon sheet-covered body into a waiting ambulance. Sheila's friends watch in silence as the vehicle pulls aw A BURP OF SIREN to part the crowd of teens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fighting tears)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asthma attack...what 17-year old has a  fatal asthma attack?  She was gonna be a  doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was Freddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough of that crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw it. It was my dream.  I brought  Sheila in... A horrible realization dawns on Alice. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, I brought her in, like Kristen  did with me... Rick tries to help, touches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon... Alice breaks free, leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't!  I gave Sheila to him and now  she's dead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen's story really got to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not so sure it's a story.  I mean,  look around, we're dropping off like  flies here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice empties her pockets on her vanity table.  She comes with Sheila's gadget.  She begins to tinker with it, she  hefts it, sizes it up.  She sets it down and looks up at mirror.  She hesitantly reaches out and pulls another photo off th mirror, revealing more of her reflection.  It's a picture of her and Sheila, she puts it down. Alice image is prettier, stronger. She HEARS A NOISE from downstairs and leaves her room to  investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice enters the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick? Alice flicks on the lights.  She gasps.  Her father is  sitting at the table.  He looks up at her, smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.  I heard about what happened at the  school.  I guess I haven't been very much  of a father through this. Alice shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, I've been using that excuse since  your mother died. He crosses to the fridge, opens the door, and bends down take a look.  The door blocks Alice's and our view of him JOHNSON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I promise honey, I'll make things  better for you... The fridge door SLAMS shut, revealing Johnson. JOHNSON (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if I could only kick the habit. He's holding an oversized martini glass.  His face looks the worst case of alcoholic deterioration.  Blood seeps f burst blood vessels in his eyes, his nose is red and line and warped. He's wearing Freddy's sweater.  He takes a swig off the h Vodka bottle.  He vomits up blood as he speaks. JOHNSON (cont'd) (Freddy's voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice bolts awake in bed, sweaty and short of breath.  Ri bursts in and hits the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard you screaming.  Was it a bad one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't the dream master work for you  anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find him. Rick notices Sheila's gadget on the vanity.  It looks lik it's been taken apart and modified.  It looks nastier.  H picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, since when do you play Thomas  Edison?  This looks like Sheila's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is...was. It's a zapper, it might help  me stay awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, or turn you into toast. Alice goes and takes it from him.  She hangs it on the mi frame by its wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't go back to sleep again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't slept much either.  Since  Kristen... Alice looks sympathetically at her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss her, too.  She gave me her ability  but I don't know how to use it.  I can  bring people into my dream, but I can't  protect them. Alice looks straight at her brother. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freddy lives in my dreams, Rick.  Like he  did with Kristen.  My dreams, the one  thing I had to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figure it out?!?!  I'll be insane before  I figure it out.  The only thing I'm sure  of is that I can't go to sleep.  Not  while he's using me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we'll stay up together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is standing behind the diner's counter.  Adding up night's receipts near the cash register.  Her waitress  uniform is spotted with stains, evidence of a hard day. She finishes up the receipts and closes the cash register She then pours coffee grounds into a cup of black coffee if it were sugar.  She stirs it halfheartedly and drinks down. Dan suddenly walks in and heads for the counter, about to place an order to go. He sees that it's Alice behind the  counter, and is surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how ya doin'? Alice looks up.  From the look of her, she's not doing th well.  Dan is taken a bit aback by her appearance. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haven't seen you around lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been working double shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extra money, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, you know why, you just don't  believe me. Dan looks around and leans in to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No offense, or anything, but it's kind of  hard to swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The story is, the deaths you can't argue  with. Alice's eyes well up.  She begins to come unraveled. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do.  I can't stop  it.  Why doesn't he just kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you been awake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three days. Dan lets this sink in.  Alice becomes embarrassed and sel conscious under Dan's scrutiny. ALICE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you understand?  Every time I  sleep, someone might die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's assume this whole thing is  true. Why does Freddy all of a sudden  need you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen was the last child left of the  people who killed Freddy.  Maybe Freddy  can't get to new kids without someone  like me.  Someone to bring them to him. Dan and Alice are both silent for a moment.  They look at each other.  Dan reads the mix of emotions on Alice's fac guilt, shame, anger, exhaustion.  He's about to say somet when a sudden voice calls out.  Dan's date, a pretty and  polished CHEERLEADER TYPE, appears at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny, we're going to be late for the  drive-in! Dan is embarrassed, so is Alice, who's also jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to get back. Alice hurries off to the kitchen as Dan watches in  frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dan and a BUDDY are suiting up for practice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ninety-three days until summer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter man, getting tired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm getting worried.  Let's see if we  survive until summer.  It's been open  season this semester.  Pretty weird  stuff. Dan and his buddy spot Rick entering and sit down on one the benches. BUDDY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Speaking of weird, you gotta feel for  that guy.  Dead girlfriend and a basket  case sister. Dan angrily reacts to this.  He shoves the buddy up again the lockers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Learn to shut up, asshole! Dan heads for Rick.  He sits down next to him. DAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been up with Alice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How she doing?  I ran into her last  night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's blaming herself for Sheila.  I know  how it feels.  I've been thinking about  Kristen.  Maybe I could've stopped it, if  I'd listened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About Freddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?  You ever look over this  town's history?  Not a safe place to be a  teenager.  Anyway, if I'm next, watch  your back. Dan smiles at the gallows humor. The coach bellows into the locker room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey you bozos, up and out!  NOW!! As Dan and the other boys head out to PE class, Rick deto to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick heads to a stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alice is struggling to stay awake in a back row of the cl At the front, a typical high school lecturer drones on in boring monotone. We hear the words from Alice's point of view as they dist as she gets closer and closer to falling asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
